discussion_comments.comment_body: I would leave as is. I don't want to get into details why, to not go too much off the main pr topic, it's also not as important. In short, explicit > implicit, also "open issues" suggests better to a complete noob that doesn't even know that "issues" means issue listing not "issues" as "problems" (this is going a bit too deep already, sigh...)

attributes:
       label: How to reproduce
       description: "How can someone else reproduce the issue?"
+      placeholder: |
+        1. ...
+        2. ...
+        3. ...
+
     validations:
       required: true
 
+  - type: markdown
+    attributes:
+      value: |
+        ## Additional info section
+
+        In the section below you will be asked to upload some files.
+
+        When including text files (such as logs or config), please **always ATTACH** them, and not paste them directly.
+
+        <u>This is important</u> because pasting text directly clutters the issue with unnecessary keywords, making github issue search useless.
